article.headline: Arizona State 79, California 70
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) -- Ike Diogu put on another show, and Arizona State left the Bay Area with its first sweep in 20 years. Diogu had 25 points and seven rebounds, and the Sun Devils beat California 79-70 Saturday night for their 11th victory in 12 games. Diogu, the Pac-10's leading scorer and rebounder, had his sixth straight 20-point game for the Sun Devils (13-2, 2-1), who rallied in the second half for another win, just two days after snapping their 13-game losing streak against Stanford on Thursday night. "We've lost too many times here to lose again," Diogu said. "There just comes a point where we're all tired of losing, so everybody picked it up in the second half." Arizona State had swept the Pac-10's Bay Area road trip just three times in school history, all between 1980 and 1985. The Sun Devils hadn't won in Berkeley since 2000, even when Diogu scored 33 points in an 85-83 loss last season. Diogu punctuated another dominant game with a remarkable sequence. He blocked Rod Benson's dunk attempt with brute force on one end, then hit a feathery fallaway jumper on the other end to give the Sun Devils a 70-60 lead with 3:38 to play. His only real slip-ups came at the free throw line, where he hurt his 85.4 percent shooting on the season with a 7-for-10 performance. Steve Moore scored 18 points for the Sun Devils, who trailed at halftime but took the lead for good with a 12-0 run in three minutes midway through the second half. They shut down the undermanned Golden Bears with a simple 2-3 zone defense, and Kevin Kruger hit two big jumpers during the decisive run in Arizona State's second victory in its last nine meetings with Cal. Benson had 15 points and eight rebounds, and walk-on Martin Smith had a career-high 12 points and seven assists while playing 39 minutes for the Bears (8-6, 1-3). But leading scorer Richard Midgley was limited to six minutes with a sprained right shoulder, and Cal's season-long scoring troubles only got worse. "We've had four (conference games) where we were leading in the second half, and we end up losing," said Dominic McGuire, who had 10 points and five rebounds. "We've got to start learning how to finish games." Cal got within five points in the final minute, but Moore and Kruger made two free throws apiece. Kruger, who missed a 3-pointer at the buzzer in last season's loss at Cal, finished with 11 points. Midgley, the Bears' English point guard, was held out of the starting lineup, but entered the game midway through the first half and immediately found Dominic McGuire for an alley-oop dunk. Midgley was hurt last week against Washington State, but the injury worsened in Thursday's loss to Arizona. "He did try (to play), but it's pretty bad," Cal coach Ben Braun said of Midgley's injury. "Obviously, that's a blow to us, but we were in a good position to keep it pretty close. We're right there. We've just got to work on finishing games." Braun also shuffled his starting lineup, replacing Rod Benson and DeVon Hardin with David Paris and Kevin Langford. Braun was hoping to keep Hardin, his talented freshman center, out of foul trouble -- but Hardin still got two quick fouls as soon as he entered the game, playing just three first-half minutes.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
